description: Borrowed from French préhensile, from Latin perfect passive participle prehēnsus, from prehendō (“grasp, seize”) + adjective suffix -ile, from Latin -ilis.

entries.meaning: (zoology) Able to take hold of and clasp objects; adapted for grasping especially by wrapping around an object.
examples: Some monkeys have prehensile tails which they use to pick things up.
